page.title: 18Technology, Turvey
page.content: The director of British School Technolgy saw that many schoolchildren are still only taught traditional craf and design skills. A pilot scheme in Bedfordshire of a mobile Technology Bus visiting schools was so successful that Government now funds B.S.T. to help any education authority introduce technology courses into their schools. Complemented by services at Trent Polytechnic, Nottingham the Unit provides: consultancy to local authorities, in service teacher training, technician training courses, curriculum evaluation and development and supply and conversion of mobile technology units. B.S.T> currently has over 30 enquiries and firm orders for vehicle conversions and 10 authorities have requested consultation. Bedfordshire has 6 mobile Technology Units visiting 10 schools per week.
